A 1°C increase in average temperature causes a loss of up to 20% to national agriculture. Based on 1960-2006 data.
A 1°C increase in warming reduces land values by 5% for the most productive farmers in the South. Based on 1960-2006 data.
A 1°C increase in warming reduces land values by 34% for the least productive farmers in the North. Based on 1960-2006 data.
